articles.author: Romy Gilbert
articles.title: Federal government plans to increase skilled migrant intake to combat labour shortage - 9News
articles.description: Australia's skilled migrant worker intake is set to grow by 40,000 people each year as the federal government attempts to combat the ongoing national labour shortage.

articles.author: Rob Harris
articles.title: Drew Pavlou to return to Australia while still under police suspicion of Chinese embassy bomb hoax - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: Police notified Pavlou’s legal team on Friday that they had relaxed his bail conditions, pending further enquiries, for him to return on October 21.
articles.content: His British friend, Harry Allen, who had been filming the stunt, was also held by the police for around 24 hours and is being investigated on suspicion of also communicating false information to make… [+3336 chars]

articles.title: Rugby Championship: Argentina score seven tries in record win over Australia - The Guardian
articles.description: Australia have slumped to their biggest ever defeat by Argentina, a 48-17 thrashing in which Los Pumas score seven tries to two
articles.content:
The Wallabies have been unable to back up their opening Rugby Championship success, crashing to a 48-17 loss to Argentina in a helter-skelter affair in San Juan.

articles.title: Man United boss Erik ten Hag: I wanted to substitute entire team at half-time of dismal Brentford defeat - ESPN Australia
articles.description: Erik ten Hag said he wanted to substitute his entire team at half-time after a humiliating 4-0 defeat to Brentford.
articles.content:

articles.title: From next year, Johnson & Johnson baby powder sold in Australia will no longer contain talc — what's the new ingredient? - ABC News
articles.description: Johnson & Johnson says while its talc-based range will be discontinued globally from next year, its Australian products already contain the new ingredient.
articles.content:
Johnson & Johnson has announced it will stop selling talc-based baby powder in Australia in 2023, as it transitions its popular, but controversial, global product to a cornstarch base.

articles.author: 9News
articles.title: Google fined $60 million for misleading Australian Android users - 9News
articles.description: The internet giant was taken to court by the Australian Competition & Consumer Commission (ACCC) for misleading Australian Android users about how it used their location data.
